Body:
I'm writing a computer program which will randomly generate a string of letters. It then looks up the random letter collection in a dictionary, to determine if it is in fact a real word, in English.

Are there common terms in linguistics to distinguish between 'words', 'non-words', and 'possible words'?
Title: Is there a technical term to describe a sequence of letters that may or may not be a word in a given language?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe:
Travelling armchair linguist.

Never studied in an institution but read books and web with probably more breadth than depth.

Always on the road surviving in a strange foreign language, currently Mongolian and Mandarin Chinese.

And I collect dictionaries.
